pli-tv-bi-vb-ss3:5.2.2: Sp 2.693 defines pakkhasaṅkantā as joining another religion: Pakkhasaṅkantā vāti titthāyatanaṁ saṅkantā, “Pakkhasaṅkantā vā means one who has joined the ascetics of another religion.” Yet the idea of pakkha also refers to groups or factions within the Sangha, for instance, when the Sangha is split into different communities (nānāsaṁvāsa) that no longer perform legal procedures together.
